title: Error when serving rfunc model
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux Debian 9
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 0.7.0
- **Python version**: 3.7

### Describe the problem
Hi folks. I've run into a bug when trying to serve an R model. I created and saved an R model by running the `examples/r_wine` script. I then serve the model by running
```
mlflow rfunc serve -m mlruns/0/8d5350192e7e4c46bfb73445954374bb/artifacts/model
```

This all works, but I get an error when I try to hit the endpoint.

When I try this command
```
curl -d '[{"fixed acidity": 7, "volatile acidity":0.27, "citric acid":0.36, "residual sugar": 20.7, "chlorides": 0.045, "free sulfur dioxide":45, "total sulfur dioxide":170,"density":1.001,"pH":3,"sulphates":0.45,"alcohol":8.8}]' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X POST localhost:5000/invocations
```
I get the following error:
```
Invalid Request.  argument 'x' must be a raw vector
```
I've looked into the `model-serve.R` file and located the following block
```
serve_prediction <- function(json_raw, model) {
  mlflow_verbose_message("Serving prediction: ", json_raw)

  df <- data.frame()
  if (length(json_raw) > 0) {
    df <- jsonlite::fromJSON(
      rawToChar(json_raw),
      simplifyDataFrame = FALSE,
      simplifyMatrix = FALSE
    )
  }

  df <- as.data.frame(df)

  mlflow_predict_flavor(model, df)
}
```
but I'm not really sure what to do about that `raw_toChar` call. Any ideas?

BTW, awesome job on this library! I'm super excited about it.
